Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
With just over 7 years of experience in the Portuguese market, we share our DNA with more than 200 workers and position our offer according to 3 lines of service:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Bootcamps, POC, Tech Lab);
  • Nearshore.


In ADENTIS, we focus on PEOPLE. This is our emotional salary:

  • Great Work-Life balance;
  • Very flexible organizational routine;
  • Health benefits (for you and your family);
  • Team Building activities;
  • Over 300 protocols to offer you great discounts in different areas;
  • Continuous professional development sponsored by our Training and Certification Department;
  • Regular feedback on your performance through a personalized plan;
  • Comprehensive career plan and progression involving assertive performance reviews.


Responsibilities:

•Collaborate and interact regularly with diverse stakeholders and other data teams across Siemens as a consultant and enabler.

•Implement and develop solutions for business uses cases applying AI/ML techniques and frameworks, including LLM models

•Ensure security and privacy compliance with data standards for data handling and model deployment.

You must have:

•Knowledge and understanding of ML models, including LLM

•Experience working with Databases (relation and non-relational), Data Structures (json, xml) and using SQL

•Programming experience in Python and any Data Science & ML packages, such as: numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, nltk, spacy, gensim;

•Experience communicating and dealing with different stakeholders

•Familiarity with agile methodologies, such as SCRUM

•European Union Citizenship or Portuguese Working Visa / Portuguese Residency.

•Availability to go to the office, twice a week.

If you want to be part of a real People First organization, join us! Send your CV to andre.lago@adentis.pt

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We are based in Estonia and Cyprus, and we operate globally. We love to work remotely and travel the world. Having freedom, ownership and passion for recruitment are key for us.

We hire amazing tech talent for great companies

We coach highly motivated Professionals to get better careers

We empower recruiters to hire more and better Talent.

Do you want to help us to grow?

Hiire is helping CEGID, a European leader in cloud business management, hire a Data Scientist to advance the data science capabilities.

About The Role

CEGID seeks a Data Scientist to develop machine learning models, focusing on building robust models that enhance decision-making processes and drive business intelligence.

You'll be working within the AI Factory dedicated to advancing CEGID's management software through AI innovation. The primary goal is to seamlessly integrate AI features into the product line, either by enhancing functionality and user experience or by recreating user workflows to take full advantage of AI technology.

What You'll Do

  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of machine learning models tailored for finance and accounting applications;
  • Explore and develop generative AI models to address challenges and opportunities in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Collaborate with finance and accounting experts, software engineers, and data engineers to integrate machine learning solutions into existing systems;
  • Demonstrate an interest in and familiarity with MLOps tools and practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and management of machine learning models.

What We're Looking For

  • Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline;
  • Proven experience (2+ years) in developing and deploying machine learning models, preferably in the finance and accounting domain;
  • Strong programming skills in languages such as Python or R, familiarity with MLOps tools and practices;
  • Experience with generative AI models and/or NLP is a plus.

Why Join Our Client?

  • Attractive and transparent remuneration from recruitment;
  • Annual performance-based bonus aligned with individual and company goals;
  • Hybrid work model and flexible working hours;
  • 25 days of vacation per year;
  • Health insurance;
  • Access to online learning platforms and internal academy;
  • Be part of a dynamic, innovative, and growing team.

Ready to take the next step? Apply now and help shape your future, ours, and our clients’ industries’ future!

Title: Data Scientist - ML Engineer
HTML:
The DGU Data & AI Strat., Gov. & Tech area is looking to recruit a Data Scientist - ML Engineer.


EDP is a global energy group present in around 30 markets with a particular emphasis on renewable energies. With more than 45 years of experience, we have been consolidating a relevant presence on the world energy scene based on the commitment to be all-green by 2030, leading the energy transition. With more than 13,000 employees around the world, we are committed to using our energy and heart to drive a better tomorrow.


What you will do:

Data Scientist and/or ML Engineer for EDP's internal strategic projects in various business areas.

  • Understand the context of the projects in terms of products, processes and ways-of-working;
  • Design different approaches to the Data Science challenges in question;
  • Interpreting model results and explaining in business language the choices made and the potential impact of the models adopted;
  • Develop and implement Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence models to solve complex problems;
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to integrate Data Science solutions into business processes;
  • Monitoring and optimizing the performance of models in production;
  • Keep up to date with the latest trends and technologies in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence in terms of techniques as well as available technologies;
  • Documenting processes and results in a clear and accessible way for different stakeholders.

Employment type: Full-Time

Work site: Hybrid Model


What are we looking for:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data engineering, Computer engineering, Data science and advanced analytics, Information management or a related field;
  • Up to 3 years of professional experience in:
  • Designing Data Science projects, analyzing different approaches and implementing them;
  • Working in multi-disciplinary teams related to Data Science projects;
  • Excellent communication skills are essential, as this role involves explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

More than academic knowledge and technical skills, we are looking for ambitious people who are enthusiastic about the future and who bring human skills aligned with our purpose.


Equal opportunities for all

Our vision is that each person combines their unique characteristics and experiences to fulfill our mission of creating new energy for the planet. We are an inclusive employer, ensuring all candidates are treated fairly throughout the recruitment process. We welcome and value all people, and we are committed to fostering a sense of belonging for each person who is part of the EDP group.


Need more reasons to apply?

As a top employer we:

  • Empower our employees through a positive and innovative work environment that promotes collaboration and agile decision-making;
  • Respect and value each person, providing a flexible, healthy, and inclusive workplace with a range of attractive benefits;
  • Provide a meaningful work experience and prepare our people for future challenges through different opportunities for development and internal mobility;


Our efforts have resulted in several distinctions over time, highlighting the EDP group's strong positioning and its dedication and commitment to attracting and retaining the best talent:

  • Top employer certification by Top Employers Institute
  • Part of the Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index
  • Global certification as a family-responsible company by Fundación Másfamília
  • Top 100 Workplaces by Houston Chronicle


Discover our tips to enhance your performance during the recruitment process and apply until 04/04/2025 if you think you are the right fit for this opportunity.

Title: Senior Applied Data Scientist (Remote from EU)
Description:
About PriceHubble

PriceHubble is a European B2B company that builds innovative digital solutions for the financial and real estate industries based on property valuations and market insights. Leveraging big data, cutting-edge analytics, and great visualization, our product suite brings a new level of transparency to the market, enabling their customers to make real estate and investment decisions based on the most accurate data-driven insights (such as valuations, market analyses, value forecasts, building simulations or energy performance insights) and enhance the dialogue with end consumers. PriceHubble's digital solutions are designed to help all players across the entire real estate value chain (banks, asset managers, developers, property managers, and real estate agents). PriceHubble is already active in 11 countries (Switzerland, France, Germany, Austria, the United Kingdom, Japan, Netherlands, Belgium, Czech Republic, Slovakia, and the United States) and employs more than 200 people worldwide.

The opportunity

At PriceHubble, we organize our teams into Tribes. Each Tribe is responsible for a specific part of our product. They identify customer needs, create solutions, and ensure everything runs smoothly. Each Tribe operates independently, managing all aspects of its area. Engineers rotate between project teams and a group focused on maintenance and technical improvements.

The Property Intelligence Tribe provides insights to make informed real estate decisions. This includes assessing property values, tracking market trends, evaluating investment opportunities, and improving property management. Our mission is to deliver accurate property information for every residential property in our areas of operation. In that, Tribe members create the unique insights and intellectual property that drive our products.

The Tribe is a distributed team of engineers from 6 nationalities, located in 5 different European countries.

As an applied Senior Data Scientist, you will work on the ML systems that drive the core services of our platform. You will design, implement, and maintain Automated Valuation Models (AVMs) that professionals trust for assessing residential property values.

The impact you will have


Develop product features that directly drive revenue growth. Our valuation models are major selling points for our customers
Navigate cost-value trade-offs to make decisions that deliver value to customers at an appropriate cost
Implement solutions that work well in over 10 countries, while considering local specifics in your model
Lead a project from concept to launch, working with a temporary team of engineers
Raise the bar and drive the team to deliver high-quality products, services, and processes
Improve the performance and cost-efficiency of our ML models and pipelines at scale
Maintain and monitor the ML systems owned by your team



Requirements

What we look for


A product-oriented mindset and enthusiasm for contributing to user-facing products. For you, ML is a means to an end - you're focused on delivering value to customers
Excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written, that allow you to communicate effectively with cross-functional partners and mentor fellow engineers. In our distributed team setup, strong writing communication skills are essential
Hands-on, you value writing clear, simple, and maintainable code. You understand that code is read more often than it is written
You embrace a growth mindset. You always continue learning and always seek new challenges.
Over 3 years of industry experience applying machine learning to solve business problems and writing production ML pipelines



Bonus


Previous experience in PropTech
Proficient in working with geospatial data and leveraging geospatial features


We're actively seeking applications from candidates of all backgrounds.

Benefits

Join an ambitious and hungry team and enjoy the following benefits:

💰 Competitive salary because we always want to attract the best talents.

📘 Learning & Development program - We want you to feel happy, confident about improving your skills, experience level as well as your personal development success.

🏢 Very well-located offices with a great remote work policy and the possibility to work from different places.

🕓 Flexible working hours and work life balance.

Title: Data Scientist II - Performance Marketing
Description:
We believe that we are better together, and at Tripadvisor we welcome you for who you are. Our workplace is for everyone, as is our people powered platform. At Tripadvisor, we want you to bring your unique identities, abilities, and experiences, so we can collectively revolutionize travel and together find the good out there.

The Tripadvisor Data Science/Machine Learning Team is looking for an experienced individual to join a dynamic and fast-paced team to help support our Performance Marketing efforts. As an Data Scientist II, you will apply your modeling skills to a wide variety of problem spaces including, but not limited to bidding for online advertising, customer modeling, experimental design, revenue optimization, attribution, recommendations. You will have access to the newest development tools and huge data sets. You will deploy your solutions online and be able to observe the impact of your work in real time as you help the company grow.

We are looking for someone who is independent, curious, and motivated, who likes discussing ideas and will bring something new to the table. You will be working in a diverse environment where you’ll collaborate with a broad multidisciplinary team of data scientists, analysts, software engineers, and product managers. You’ll be encouraged to take ownership of your projects and to find new opportunities and problems where machine learning could be applied to improve the business.

Location: Please note, this position will be either office, hybrid or remote-based within Portugal.

About Data Science At Tripadvisor

Tripadvisor is the web's leading travel information site. At Tripadvisor, the DS/ML Team creates systems that influence the travel decisions of millions of people per day. We apply cutting edge machine learning techniques to a wide variety of areas, including recommenders, online advertising, vision, text processing, and natural language processing. To ensure continued success, Tripadvisor promotes a culture of personal development, including social activities, journal clubs, memberships in online learning resources, and participation in industry conferences. Have a great time while shaping the future of travel!

What You'll Do


Use machine learning models to solve a variety of core business problems across performance marketing.
Seek out new opportunities to apply data science and machine learning in the performance marketing space across all channels (e.g., Web, email, paid marketing)
Automate ETL pipelines
Prototype, evaluate, deploy and maintain new models in production
Design AB tests and analyze their results
Discover new ways to analyze and interpret the data
Communicate progress and interpretation of experimental results to technical and business stakeholders


Skills & Experience


PhD or Masters in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field preferred (or masters with 2+ years of practical experience)
Knowledge of AB test design and analysis
Strong background in machine learning and statistics
Solid foundation on data structures and algorithms
Proficiency in Python for numerical/statistical programming (our group relies heavily on Numpy/Pandas/Scikit-learn)
Ability to interpret and write complex SQL queries
Experience with big data technologies, such as Hive and Spark
Track record of leading the deployment and maintenance of models


We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application or the recruiting process, please make sure to reach out to your individual recruiter or our team at recruitment@tripadvisor.com

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

As a data scientist, you will be responsible for leading the design of solutions and managing the teams that develop them within a project. You will also be responsible for selecting a team with the appropriate skillset or ensuring that the team acquires the required capabilities in due time. You must also ensure proper solution delivery, monitoring, and governance using MLOps.

As a part of your job, you will:

  • Leverage data and domain knowledge to solve business problems and create quantifiable value;
  • Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models, and design suitable solutions;
  • Build and maintain (or lead the development of) data-driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms, and capacity constraint models;
  • Lead teams into delivering models using best MLOps practices;
  • Communicate final recommendations and support decision-making.


What are we looking for?

  • Degree in an analytical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science);
  • Scripting with Python and nice to have one of these languages (e.g., Pyspark, Spark-mllib);
  • Experienced with packages such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, matplotlib, and tensorflow/pytorch;
  • 2Y of project experience as a Data Scientist;
  • Professional experience with Java, Scala, or Spark;
  • Experience working with and leading teams in a project environment;
  • Experience in delivering projects using MLOps best practices.


Personal traits

  • Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
  • Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
  • Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
  • Willingness to collaborate with other players;
  • Strong communication skills.


At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Senior Data Scientist!




Requirements:

Experience in project and team management.
MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field (MSc/PhD in Data Science is a plus).
+4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role.
Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation.
Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications.
Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval.
Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG.
Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas).
Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy.
Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases.
Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis.
Good communication skills.
Fluency in English and Portuguese




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/DataScientist".




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

We are looking for an Senior Data Scientist!


Requirements:

  • Experience in project and team management.
  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field (MSc/PhD in Data Science is a plus).
  • +4 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist or a similar role.
  • Proven knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, NLP, and text dataset curation.
  • Hands-on experience in coding for real-world data analytics applications.
  • Experience in NLP tasks, such as Text Classification, NER, and Information Retrieval.
  • Experience working with LLMs, OpenAI API (or equivalent), and RAG.
  • Proficiency in Python and ML/DL packages (PyTorch, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, Pandas).
  • Solid mathematical foundations and experience in statistical consultancy.
  • Strong business sense with the ability to quickly understand use cases.
  • Familiarity with data engineering, modeling, and business analysis.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Fluency in English and Portuguese


If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/DataScientist".


Thank You! 😊


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

(Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Libson, Portugal | req23032

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will join Linde’s Global AI & Digital team in our Innovation Hub in Lisbon, and you will be responsible for developing and executing innovative AI solutions that enable our business to make better data-driven decisions across core Linde’s value streams on a global scale focusing on Personalized Preventive Care or adjacent areas in general Healthcare Analytics
In this role, you will collaborate with key business stakeholders across multiple hierarchies and regions to identify business problems where data-driven approaches can add high value
Translation of user requirements into model formulations, and selection of appropriate algorithms for model development is also part of your role
You will handle data selection, curation, and requirements setting, advanced data exploration, and visualization
Further, you conduct data pre-processing and feature engineering, develop models, including training, hyperparameter tuning, and testing
You will evaluate AI explainability and product features (recommender systems, decision support, regulatory frameworks), and implement MLOps principles
You enjoy working closely with business developers, product managers, machine learning and software engineers, IT, and business functions


What Makes You Great


You have an educational background in Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, or related quantitative fields
To be successful in this role, you possess a proven record and exceptional command in advanced programming and development environments with Python, SQL, PyCharm, VSC, PySpark, Polars, as well as all relevant libraries for predictive modelling, forecasting, and strong foundations in Statistical Modelling and Machine Learning, including understanding of underlying principles
You have experience with cloud computing and ML platforms such as Azure, Azure ML, DevOps
Experience in data visualization like Plotly, Folium, or Power BI, data engineering and automation like DataBricks is a plus
Ideally, you bring domain expertise and working experience in Personalized Health
You possess solid understanding of MLOps and DevOps principles
The role will require strong communication and collaboration skills
Result-driven mindset, critical thinking, and ability to work independently as well as part of a team, and strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex findings into clear, actionable insights, are completing your profile


Why you will love working with us

Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company with 2024 sales of $33 billion. We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain, decarbonize and protect our planet.

The company serves a variety of end markets such as chemicals & energy, food & beverage, electronics, healthcare, manufacturing, metals and mining. Linde's industrial gases and technologies are used in countless applications including production of clean hydrogen and carbon capture systems critical to the energy transition, life-saving medical oxygen and high-purity & specialty gases for electronics. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions.

Linde employees learn and abide the Linde Code of Ethics and Code of Conduct by demonstrating honesty, integrity, professionalism in all communications, actions, and decisions.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you’re looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you?

We are looking forward to receiving your application via our online job market.

Your contact person

Linde GmbH, Corporate Office

Florian Voigtländer

+49 152 06180296

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde Portugal, LDA acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About Us

NymCard’s mission is to enable fintech and financial innovators to launch frictionless payment programmes with our modern infrastructure, at record speed. Our open API modern card issuing platform provides flexibility and control to issue cards, authorize transactions and manage payment operations with just one integration and one partner.

We are a team of industry experts and technology innovators who take a dynamic approach to solving complex industry challenges. NymCard has an open and collaborative work environment and together we make up the NymCardian Nation. We power possibilities for our customers AND each other by bringing the best talent together to do the best quality work we can.

By staying true to our core values: Respect, Transparency, Collaboration, Quality, Speed, Courage, NymCards strives to build a global team as diverse as the markets we serve. It is a very exciting time to join NymCard and as our Business grows, you and your opportunities will grow with it. To Learn more about NymCard visit our Website and LinkedIn.

The Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing and deploying ML models for real-time identity verification and fraud detection. You’ll work with computer vision, deep learning, and scalable ML pipelines to enhance document verification, biometric security, and fraud prevention. This is a Greenfield project, meaning you will have the opportunity to shape the ML infrastructure from the ground up.

Responsibilities


Develop and deploy ML models for document verification, OCR, and fraud detection.
Build and optimize computer vision and biometric authentication models (facial recognition, liveness detection).
Design scalable MLOps pipelines for training, deploying, and monitoring machine learning models.
Work with structured & unstructured data to improve model accuracy and efficiency.
Implement anomaly detection systems to identify fraudulent documents or transactions.
Collaborate with data engineers to integrate ML models into the NymCard platform.
Stay updated with advancements in deep learning, NLP, and security-driven AI.
Ensure model interpretability and fairness, optimizing for accuracy and security.


Skills and Qualifications


Strong proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-Learn.
Experience with computer vision (OpenCV, YOLO, or Transformers for image processing).
Hands-on experience with OCR (Tesseract, Google Vision AI, AWS Textract).
Familiarity with facial recognition and liveness detection techniques.
Strong understanding of MLOps tools (MLflow, Airflow, Kubernetes, Docker).
Experience with cloud ML deployment (AWS SageMaker, GCP AI, or Azure ML).
Knowledge of data engineering workflows, including ETL, SQL, and NoSQL.
Familiarity with fraud detection models (anomaly detection, predictive modeling).
Show more

Title: Applied Research Scientist
Description:
Job Req Number: 93415

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS

Your responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work



Our requirements:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications.
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer:



Permanent contract (with basic salary in 14 installments per year)
Private medical care
English courses - financial or co-financed by company
Food allowance (EUR 9.60, per working day)
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work (3 days in a week at the office)
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Good access to public transports



DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and X.

Title: AI Engineer / Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for Data Scientists or AI Engineers to join our Data & AI team, which is working on some of the most complex and rewarding projects in Generative AI, Intelligent Applications, Business, and Operational Use Cases with ML that exist in the country.




You can get to know more about our Data & AI activities in the following link:

​Data & AI | Claranet




Your responsibilities include:

Contributing to an AI team that designs, deploys, and monitors end-to-end Machine Learning or Generative AI backed solutions
Cleaning, processing, and assessing different data sources to extract valuable analysis and business in puts.
Exploring and benchmarking data solutions to fulfill the business stakeholders' requirements.
Participating in internal initiatives that explore cutting-edge tools or concepts to build prototypes that may add value to our customers.
Designing best practices and transmitting know-how to the client teams.




You must have:

Fluency in one programming language (e.g. Python)
Skill in data discovery and transformation employing SQL-like languages.
Option 1 (Machine Learning):

Understanding of key Machine Learning fundamental concepts (bias-variance trade-off, feature engineering, metrics, etc.)

Knowledge of algorithms (e.g., decision trees, clustering, neural networks, etc.)

Familiarity with packages like Pandas, Numpy, Scikit, Matplotlib or others

Option 2 (Generative AI):

Understanding of GenAI concepts (prompt engineering, chains, agents, etc.)

Familiarity with packages like Langchain, LlamaIndex or others

Fluency in Portuguese.




We value:

Data Science/AI Engineering Certifications.
Knowledge and experience with MLOps concepts and practices.
Experience working in cloud-based environments (Azure/GCP/AWS).
Experience working with container based environments (Docker, Kubernetes or Cloud-based solutions)
Experience working with web frameworks such as FastAPI or Flask
Practice in distributed processing frameworks such as Spark or Apache Beam
Ability to communicate effectively with technical, non-technical, and business audiences.
Fluency in English




We offer:

Balanced and friendly work environment.
Access to above-average salary packages, career development, and certification programs
Integration into the biggest IT MSP operating in Portugal by revenue.
Integration into a company with more than 150 certified Cloud Engineers in Portugal among the top hyperscalers.
Being part of one of only five vendors in the world that has all three audited MSP certifications from the hyperscalers: Microsoft Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform.
Close relationship and access to the hyperscalers.




Workplace: Lisbon (preferential) - Flexible




Make modern happen!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Are you our new Machine Learning Engineer specialising in machine learning and data pipelines? 🚀


Ready to leverage your ML expertise in a fast-growing HR & payroll tech scale-up? We're looking for an experienced ML Engineer to join our team in Lisbon. In this role, you'll drive the development of data-driven models to make our company ambition of a 100% Self Driving Payroll reality or a bit closer to reality. Excited to transform complex data into powerful insights that drive business decisions? Keep reading!


What can you expect of this role?

As a ML Engineer, you’ll play a pivotal part in building advanced machine learning solutions. Ranging from salary benchmarking and predictive analytics to anomaly detection, all leveraging our extensive payroll data. Your work will help drive Nmbrs toward our vision of a self-driving payroll application.


About Nmbrs:

We're a fast-growing scale-up building innovative HR & payroll technology. With 140+ colleagues in Amsterdam, Lisbon, and Stockholm, we do things differently. No traditional managers, a 4-day workweek, and the freedom to make an impact.


You will be successful in this role if you:

  • Are proficient in Python for machine learning development and scripting;
  • Have strong understanding of supervised learning fundamentals (experience with regression and classification algorithms like Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, and Neural Networks);
  • Have solid experience with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn);
  • Are experienced with data preprocessing and feature engineering using relevant libraries (Pandas, NumPy, NLTK);
  • Have experience with SQL Server for data querying and manipulation;
  • Have experience building and maintaining automated machine learning pipelines to increase efficiency and reliability;
  • Have experience in Azure Databricks for large-scale data processing and machine learning using Apache Spark and PySpark;
  • Have experience building and maintaining automated machine learning pipelines to increase efficiency and reliability;
  • Are fluent in English;
  • Have attention to detail.


Don't worry if you don't fit 100% of the requirements you can still apply if you feel you fit the majority of them :)


What’s in it for you?

  • We offer a gross annual salary 39k to 49k including holiday allowance, depending on experience;
  • The opportunity to develop with the newest AI tools like Devin AI, Claude (code), Cursor, Github Copilot or any other subscription you feel would boost your efficiency;
  • Nmbrs is a flat organisation in which you have the freedom and responsibility to do what you are good at and have an impact, in an agile working environment;
  • A personal coach who helps you with your personal and professional growth as well as a yearly budget for training and personal development;
  • We ensure a healthy work-life balance;
  • For us full-time means a 4-day workweek giving you one paid personal day to spend in a way that will benefit you the most;
  • We have a big and light office space close to the Cais do Sodré and all the floors of the office are accessible by elevator;
  • We work hybrid at Nmbrs;
  • We end the summer by bringing all offices together for an amazing event at a very secret location to spark togetherness and innovation and celebrate with each other;
  • Additionally we organise fun events of different themes every month, think: game nights, movie nights, ping pong tournaments, or pizza party (this events are voluntary);
  • Nmbrs offers the opportunity to go on an exchange to our offices in Amsterdam or Stockholm for up to 4 months.



Please note: We are not able to consider candidates who are not living and working in Portugal. At this moment we are not providing relocation sponsorships.


As part of our hiring process, we conduct a criminal background check for all candidates reaching the final stages. This helps us ensure a safe and secure environment for everyone.


At Nmbrs, we celebrate diversity and promote an inclusive environment in which our team members from all different backgrounds, ages, genders, or sexual orientations feel equally appreciated. To achieve this, we are committed to shaping a hiring process that provides everyone with an equal opportunity to get hired.

Title: React Developer
HTML:
Com mais de 8 anos de existência a nível nacional, contamos com mais de 200 colaboradores com o nosso ADN e posicionamo-nos no mercado com 3 ofertas de serviço:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Estágios, POC, Laboratório Tecnológico);
  • Nearshore.

Na ADENTIS centramo-nos nas PESSOAS e é este o nosso salário emocional:

  • Equilíbrio entre a vida profissional e pessoal;
  • Flexibilidade na rotina organizacional;
  • Benefícios de saúde para colaboradores e familiares;
  • Eventos Team Building;
  • Protocolo com mais de 300 parceiros;
  • Formação contínua através de um centro profissional de formação e certificação;
  • Acompanhamento e feedback contínuo através de um plano personalizado;
  • Progressão de carreira através de avaliações objetivas e diretas.

O que procuramos:

  • Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Experiência profissional superior a 3 anos em React;
  • Conhecimentos avançados em JavaScript e TypeScript, HTML, CSS;
  • Experiência em projetos com metodologia agile;
  • Bom nível de inglês falado e escrito.

Se queres fazer parte de uma empresa People First, junta-te a nós.

We walk with you!

Na Adentis defendemos a igualdade e valorizamos a diversidade. Criamos um ambiente seguro, diversificado e onde as oportunidades são iguais para todos os colaboradores!

Não discriminamos com base em idade, etnia, orientação sexual, género, deficiência ou qualquer fator que não seja o mérito.

Todas as candidaturas com competências para o cargo são bem-vindas!

Title: Data Scientist, Staff
Description:
We Are:

At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.

You Are:

You are an experienced and passionate Data Scientist who thrives on solving complex problems and delivering valuable insights. With a strong background in statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization, you have a proven track record of applying these skills to real-world business challenges. You are a logical thinker, detail-oriented, and possess excellent communication skills, allowing you to simplify complex data science concepts for diverse stakeholders.

What You’ll Be Doing:


Execute Internal Audit (IA) data science and analytics projects, including risk assessment, audit execution, and special projects.
Partner with IA team members to identify questions and issues for data analytics and experiments across various projects.
Collaborate with appropriate stakeholders and partners to execute projects from design to delivery.
Experiment and implement proofs of concepts across multiple processes and datasets.
Design and implement scripts that cleanse, integrate, and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources, applying statistical analytics and machine learning where appropriate.
Create visualizations, including dashboards, to display data-backed insights and predictive results.
Engage with team members to promote, adhere to, and contribute to continually improving the team’s data science standards and processes.
Communicate and explain your work and results to stakeholders.
Continually learn and develop applicable technical and professional skills.
Mentor junior data scientists, analysts, and audit staff.
Develop professional relationships within the team and across the organization.


The Impact You Will Have:


Enhance the effectiveness of the Internal Audit department through advanced data science and analytics.
Identify hidden trends and patterns that can lead to process improvements and risk mitigation opportunities.
Support informed decision-making by providing valuable insights from complex datasets.
Drive innovation by experimenting with and implementing new data science techniques and technologies.
Improve the efficiency and accuracy of audit processes through data-driven approaches.
Mentor and develop the next generation of data scientists and analysts.


What You’ll Need:


Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field; Advanced degree preferred.
5+ years of professional experience in applying statistical modeling, machine learning algorithms, and natural-language processing to business problems.
Experience building predictive models using R or Python.
Experience manipulating large datasets using R, Python, or SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, and ggplot.
Experience developing locally with LLMs/AI agents is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex data science concepts and results for diverse audiences.
Experience using git (GitLab/GitHub) or other software development version control systems is preferred.
Familiarity with SAP and Salesforce is a plus.
Experience using data science and analytics for auditing purposes is a plus.


Who You Are:

You are a collaborative and innovative professional who is always looking to push the boundaries of what is possible with data science. You have a keen eye for detail and a passion for uncovering insights from complex datasets. Your communication skills are top-notch, allowing you to convey complex ideas in a clear and concise manner. You are a lifelong learner, always eager to develop new skills and stay updated with the latest advancements in data science and technology. Your ability to mentor and inspire junior team members makes you a valuable leader within the organization.

The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:

You will be part of the Internal Audit (IA) team within the Finance function, working on a variety of projects each year that cover operational, financial, technology, and regulatory compliance processes. The IA team uses data science to provide greater value to stakeholders by designing statistical models for outlier detection and applying advanced analytics to identify hidden trends and patterns. This collaborative team partners with various departments across the company to design and execute impactful data science and analytics projects.

Rewards and Benefits:

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings.

Title: Associate Data Scientist 679
Description:
The global data privacy software market is projected to grow from $2.36 billion in 2022 to $25.85 billion by 2029.

So, if you are searching for an innovative career, then the cybersecurity industry might just be the one for you. Protegrity, an international provider of data protection solutions, is looking for new team members who want to make an impact in a company that prioritizes something we all care about: our privacy.

We need people who recognize the opportunity, can plan effectively, take action and execute in the enterprise marketplace with our intuitive, diverse, and future-forward global teams.

So, are you up for collaborating with the best in data security?

Join us on this journey and make an impact with one of the top 25 global software providers. We look forward to making our world become a better place with you on our team.

Apply and discover what’s next today!

Applied scientist

Protegrity is looking for an applied scientist in the field of NLP. You’ll work in a team of software engineers and machine learning practitioners in designing, building and maintaining applications within the context of data security and data privacy.

Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain high-quality software applications.
Contribute to the continuous development, enhancement, and maintenance of both existing and new products/features.
Write clean, scalable, and efficient code following industry best practices.
Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality and share knowledge.
Engage in agile practices within the team/organization as both an individual contributor and a team player.
Research and develop new machine learning-based solutions to advance the usability, security, and privacy of data at scale.
In the long-term, research and develop new solutions in the field of privacy-enhancing technologies and data security.


Qualifications


2-4 years of industry experience.
Experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably Keras and Pytorch) and machine learning algorithms and respective frameworks.
NLP experience.
Familiarity with cloud platforms, with a focus on AWS, is preferred.
Experience with common data manipulation frameworks (Pandas, NumPy, etc.).
Ability to design and conduct experiments to further improve the performance of machine learning systems.
Strong programming skills with fluency in Python.
Working knowledge of CI/CD best practices.


Why Protegrity


This role offers the opportunity to innovate at the intersection of GenAI safety, privacy, and governance. You will play a pivotal role in helping customers establish trust and compliance in their AI applications while contributing to the company’s technical strategy and industry leadership. Join us in shaping the future of GenAI security.
We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package as well as the excitement, challenges, and rewards of a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company.
Become a member of a leading Data and GenAI Protection, Privacy and Security company during one of the best market opportunities to come along in a generation.
Competitive Compensation/Total Reward Packages
Paid Time Off (PTO)
Work on global projects with diverse, energetic, team members who respect each other and celebrate differences.


Working Model


This role is available as a hybrid role. You will work out of your home and be in office 2-3 days a week to attend on-site meetings and working sessions based on business needs. In certain circumstances, the work model may change to accommodate business needs.


We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits with generous vacation and holiday time off. All employees are also provided access to ongoing learning & development.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is our priority. We are committed to an environment of acceptance where you are free to bring your full self to work. All qualified applicants and current employees will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Please reference Section 12: Supplemental Notice for Job Applicants in our Privacy Policy to inform you of the categories of personal information that we collect from individuals who inquire about and/or apply to work for Protegrity USA, Inc., or its parent company, subsidiaries or affiliates, and the purposes for which we use such personal information.

Title: AI Applications Engineer
Description:
Job Description:

At Ferring Pharmaceuticals, we help people around the world build families and live better lives. We are entrepreneurial and innovative, with a global team focused on scientific advances in the areas of reproductive and women’s health, gastroenterology and urology. Ferring + You is all about working together and sharing ideas, so that we can bring science to life for patients around the world. Every person at Ferring works together to change lives and help people build families. Our corporate teams offer empowering, innovative, challenging and rewarding careers – we are motivated to make a difference. To reach our full potential we collaborate, and respect and value diverse contributions so that we can grow as an organization and as professionals. Together we can influence the world around us to make life and work better.

Ferring+You

As an AI Applications Engineer, you will focus on applied AI by delivering AI solutions by leveraging the AI Platform framework.

You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders, to develop and deploy AI-driven applications that meet business needs.

You will contribute to the design and development of Ferring’s AI Platform Framework by delivering reusable and scalable AI capabilities.

As an AI Applications Engineer you will be able to work with on concrete business use cases from a technology and functional perspective.

We are in the process of extending our data analytics capabilities and laying out the foundations of a novel framework to deliver AI solutions.

You will be part of a global Analytics team. Working from our Lisbon center of excellence, you will collaborate with global stakeholders and in different business domains.

Your day at Ferring


Develop and deploy AI-driven applications using the AI Platform framework.
Contribute to the definition of the AI Platform framework roadmap and deliver reusable and scalable AI applications capabilities.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into AI solutions.
Navigate and utilize various AI frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) to build, train, fine-tune and deploy machine learning models.
Prototype and deliver web applications and APIs that integrate AI models and solutions, ensuring seamless user experiences.
Work closely with business stakeholders, analytics stream leads and IT business partners organization to identify opportunity for the application of AI solutions.
Combine machine learning and analytics expertise with business domain knowledge to deliver effective AI solutions.
Design and implement user interfaces (UI) and user experiences (UX) that leverage AI capabilities.
Ensure AI applications are scalable, secure, and maintainable.
Continuously monitor and improve the performance of AI applications in production.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to AI applications and workflows.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI, machine learning, and web development technologies.


Behind our innovation…There’s you


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
3 to 7 years of professional experience in AI, machine learning, or data science roles.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and SQL.
Experience with web development frameworks (e.g., Flask, Dash, Streamlit, Shiny) and RESTful API design (e.g. FastAPI).
Proficiency in AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Proven track record of delivering Machine Learning, AI, and/or GenAI projects.
Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistics, and their application to business problems.
Proficiency in working with CI/CD processes for AI projects (DevOps, MLOps, DataOps, LLMOps).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
Commitment to staying updated with the latest technology trends and industry best practices.


People come first at Ferring


Get inspired from our commitment to advocate for everyone’s right to build a family, no matter who you are, where you live or who you love.
Our inclusive support package – “Building Families at Ferring” provides equal and accessible policies for all employees who wish to start their family journey, ensuring a global standard, irrespective of location and role.
Parental leave for both birthing and non-birthing parents.
Extended support on family building journey Making a difference in the life of millions of people means we succeed by working together. Our diverse backgrounds, experiences, expertise, and perspectives enable us to find solutions to even the most challenging problems, and our success is tied to each team member’s contributions. Imagine the power of your career when it’s Ferring + You.


Behind our purpose… There’s you

If our mission and your vision are aligned, please apply! We strive to build and maintain an inclusive and diverse workplace with equal opportunities and mutual respect for all employees regardless of their backgrounds and socioeconomic status.

Note to agencies: this search is being managed by Ferring’s Talent Acquisition team. Kindly do not send us spontaneous profiles

Location:Ferring Service Center Portugal

Title: Python Developer
HTML:
Seeking a Python Developer: Rhino, are you there?

At WE ARE META, we focus on finding the perfect match between our Rhinos and our clients.

Why join us?

  • Expand your network: As a consultant at We Are META, you’ll have access to a network of national and international partners across diverse sectors of the tech industry.
  • Enjoy our perks: When you join the crash you’ll have an array of benefits, to help you achieve the best work-life balance.
  • Get your perfect match: Our recruiters do their best to get the best position for you, whether in terms of working policy (remote, hybrid, on-site) or the company’s culture.
  • Personalized support: With our career coach, we assure that all your needs are being met and you’re being provided everything you need to excel in your professional life because the well-being of our Rhinos is our number one priority.

Perks Of Becoming a Rhino

  • You’ll get a welcome kit 📚
  • Opportunities for career progression 📈
  • Live on the edge with our health insurance 🏥
  • Watch your favorite shows and music with HBO and Spotify accounts 📺 🎵
  • Coverflex meal card 🍲 💳
  • Other protocols and special discounts ✨

For this position, the perfect Rhino should have the following skills:

  • Completed studies in computer science, software engineering or a related field or equivalent professional experience;
  • 5+ years of experience as a Python developer, especially in backend development;
  • Experience with databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL, REDIS, DynamoB);
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs and web services;
  • Understanding of asynchronous programming and event-driven architecture;
  • Knowledge of containerization and deployment with Docker;
  • Experience with version control systems, especially Git;
  • Fluency in English is mandatory;
  • Availability for fully remote work based in Portugal

Become a part of the crash. In a world of unicorns, be a Rhino!

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:




• DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;

• DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;

• DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for a Python Developer for a hybrid project in Porto.




Key Responsibilities




· Create / maintain Python and deploy web applications using Django

· Create / maintain Python scripts that collect monitoring data and provide task automation

· Perform code review

· Optimize and refactor existing code

· Work with other engineers to containerize applications to deploy on kubernetes and docker.

· Perform routine maintenance on our various monitoring platforms.

Required Experience




· 2+ years of Python Web development using Django and Asyncio framework

· Advanced knowledge of Git / Gitlab

· Advanced knowledge of setting up Highly Available application using technologies like load balancers nginx/ keepalived

· Knowledge of multithreading concepts

· Good understanding of MySQL databases

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Good communication skills

· Team player

Desirable Qualifications




· Experience operating python applications in docker / Kubernetes

· Experience deploying applications into public cloud

· Development on Uvicorn / Gunicorn

· Experience of work with JavaScript. Our existing applications has backend on Python and frontend on JS

· AWS / GCP experience

· Understand and experience working with messaging systems (Kafka, Redis)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to daniela.adao@decskill.com with reference “DA/PD”.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

· Experience of work with JavaScript. Our existing applications has backend on Python and frontend on JS

· AWS / GCP experience

· Understand and experience working with messaging systems (Kafka, Redis)


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to daniela.adao@decskill.com with reference “DA/PD”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data scientist
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data scientist

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Remote from Portugal. The candidates must be in Portugal.

The amazing you, will have:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in data science roles, specifically with Apache Spark and Scala.
Strong understanding of big data frameworks and distributed computing principles.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Experience with other programming languages such as Python.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and services related to big data processing.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their practical application.
Fluent in English and Portuguese.




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Scientist for a hybrid project.




Key Responsibilities:

• Improving NER/NLP Algorithms:

-Analyze and optimize existing Named Entity Recognition (NER) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) algorithms to enhance their accuracy and efficiency for client projects.

- Conduct performance testing and validation of models using real and synthetic datasets.

• Establishing a Document Annotation Platform:

-Design and implement an annotation platform to facilitate the tagging and labeling of textual data for various client use cases.

-Collaborate with business experts to define annotation criteria and ensure data quality.

• Fine-Tuning Algorithms:

-Customize and optimize machine learning models for specific client needs and use cases within the organization.

-Apply advanced techniques such as transfer learning to improve model performance, especially when working with limited datasets.

• Creating an AI Library/Framework:

-Develop and document a library or framework that facilitates the integration and deployment of AI models in production environments for clients.

-Ensure that models meet production standards and performance requirements tailored to client specifications.

• Participating in Business Workshops:

-Engage in workshops with clients and business teams to understand their Data Science needs and identify entities for labeling.

-Collaborate on developing actionable use cases that leverage the algorithms developed and implement them effectively in client projects.




Requirements:

• At least 3 years of professional experience, holding a BAC+5 level degree (university, business school, or engineering school) with a specialization in Data Science

• You are proficient in Python and API integration, with solid knowledge of Big Data technologies (Hadoop) and AI, including Named Entity Recognition (NER), Natural Language Processing (NLP), computer vision, and clustering

• Fluent English (mandatory)

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hey there, future Data Scientist at Enlitia! 🌟 Ready to power up our innovative projects in the renewable energy sector? As a key player in our team, you'll be at the forefront of developing algorithms, monitoring performance, optimizing processes, and conducting insightful data analysis. Your role will involve collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and effectively communicating results to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. If you're a highly organized and motivated professional with a passion for sustainability, we're eager to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Modelling:


Dive deep into large and complex datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and golden nuggets of insight.
Craft and deploy statistical models and machine learning algorithms that crack business problems wide open.
Conduct hypothesis testing and A/B experiments to validate your findings like a master.


Data Management


Extract, clean, and preprocess data from a variety of sources, ensuring top-notch data quality and consistency.
Build and maintain datasets and data pipelines that are as smooth as a well-oiled machine.
Team up with data engineers to optimize data storage and retrieval processes for peak efficiency.


Business Collaboration


Partner with stakeholders to grasp business objectives and data requirements with laser-like precision.
Turn complex analytical findings into actionable business recommendations that hit the mark.
Present insights and results to non-technical audiences with visualizations and reports that make the data dance.


Tool And Technology Utilization


Harness the power of statistical and machine learning tools (e.g., R, Python, SAS) to analyze data like a wizard.
Use data visualization tools (e.g., Grafana, Matplotlib, notebooks) to communicate your findings with flair.
Tap into big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) for large-scale data processing that packs a punch.


Continuous Learning


Stay on the cutting edge of data science, machine learning, and related fields to keep your skills razor-sharp.
Experiment with new tools, techniques, and methodologies to keep pushing the envelope of data science capabilities.


Minimum Requirements

Requirements


Hold a BSc, MSc, or PhD in Computer Science, Electronic Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics, because we like our Data Scientists powered up.
4+ years of experience in data science or a related field. Show us your analytical battle scars (metaphorical, of course).
Proven experience with statistical analysis and machine learning, ideally with tabular and time-series data. Your data prowess speaks for itself.
Proficiency in programming languages, mainly Python and SQL. Knowledge about OOP, Unix and Git is a plus.
Familiarity with data visualization and dashboarding tools (e.g., Grafana, PowerBI). You make data come to life.
Knowledge of concepts and techniques in NLP (Natural Language Processing) is a plus. Language data doesn't stand a chance against you.
Understanding of big data frameworks and tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus. Big data challenges are your playground.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. No puzzle is too complex for you.
Strong communication and presentation abilities. You turn complex data into compelling stories.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Collaboration is your middle name (literally).
Attention to detail and a commitment to data quality. You ensure our data is always top-notch.


Benefits And More


Extra vacation days, everyone deserves some time to recharge.
Healthcare insurance, because health is wealth.
Meal tickets, we know debugging builds an appetite.
Office options in Lisbon and Porto, because great work deserves a great location.
Learning allowance, knowledge is power.


About Us

At Enlitia, we're not just another startup; we're crafting the future of renewable energy with our top-notch algorithms and boundless enthusiasm. Join us in driving innovation and making sustainability more than just a buzzword.

Ready to enlighten the future?

Join us at Enlitia where tech meets sustainability, and every line of code makes a difference. Apply now and let's create a future we can all be proud of.
Show more
